Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pour \Pour\, v. i. To flow, pass, or issue in a stream, or as a stream; to fall continuously and abundantly; as, the rain pours; the people poured out of the theater. [1913 Webster]
In the rude throng pour on with furious pace. --Gay. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pour \Pour\, n. A stream, or something like a stream; a flood. [Colloq.] ``A pour of rain.'' --Miss Ferrier. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pour \Pour\, v. i. To pore. [Obs.] --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pour \Pour\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Poured}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Pouring}.] [OE. pouren, of uncertain origin; cf. W. bwrw to cast, throw, shed, bwrw gwlaw to rain.] 1. To cause to flow in a stream, as a liquid or anything flowing like a liquid, either out of a vessel or into it; as, to pour water from a pail; to pour wine into a decanter; to pour oil upon the waters; to pour out sand or dust. [1913 Webster]
2. To send forth as in a stream or a flood; to emit; to let escape freely or wholly. [1913 Webster]
I . . . have poured out my soul before the Lord. --1 Sam. i. 15. [1913 Webster]
Now will I shortly pour out my fury upon thee. --Ezek. vii. 8. [1913 Webster]
London doth pour out her citizens ! --Shak. [1913 Webster]
Wherefore did Nature pour her bounties forth With such a full and unwithdrawing hand ? --Milton. [1913 Webster]
3. To send forth from, as in a stream; to discharge uninterruptedly. [1913 Webster]
Is it for thee the linnet pours his throat ? --Pope. [1913 Webster]

pour v 1: cause to run; "pour water over the floor" 2: move in large numbers; "people were pouring out of the theater"; "beggars pullulated in the plaza" [syn: {swarm}, {stream}, {teem}, {pullulate}] 3: pour out; "the sommelier decanted the wines" [syn: {decant}, {pour out}] 4: flow in a spurt; "Water poured all over the floor" 5: supply in large amounts or quantities; "We poured money into the education of our children" 6: rain heavily; "Put on your rain coat-- it's pouring outside!" [syn: {pelt}, {stream}, {rain cats and dogs}, {rain buckets}]
